column7: Muamba de Galinha | A chicken stew flavored with palm oil and okra, sometimes containing palm nuts.
column8: Funje | A smooth, polenta-like side dish made from cassava flour.
column9: Kizaka | A type of leafy green, similar to spinach, often cooked in oil and garlic.

column7: Asado | A barbecue technique involving a range of meats, most notably beef, cooked on a grill called a 'parrilla' or an open fire.
column8: Empanadas | Crescent-shaped pastries filled with meats, cheese, or vegetables.
column9: Mate | A traditional caffeine-rich infused drink made from the leaves of the yerba mate plant.

column4: Filipino, English (both official), various regional languages
column7: Adobo | A popular dish and cooking process in Philippine cuisine that involves meat, seafood, or vegetables marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, and garlic, which is browned in oil, and simmered in the marinade.
column8: Sinigang | A soup or stew characterized by its sour and savory taste most often associated with tamarind (sampalok).
column9: Halo-halo | A popular Filipino cold dessert which is a mix of shaved ice and evaporated milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans, jellies, and fruits.
